class.name: StreamPeerTCP
class.description: TCP stream peer. This object can be used to connect to TCP servers, or also is returned by a TCP server.

method.name: connect_to_host
method.description: Connects to the specified [code]host:port[/code] pair. A hostname will be resolved if valid. Returns [constant OK] on success or [constant FAILED] on failure.

method.name: get_connected_host
method.description: Returns the IP of this peer.

method.name: get_connected_port
method.description: Returns the port of this peer.

method.name: get_status
method.description: Returns the status of the connection, see [enum Status].

method.name: is_connected_to_host
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this peer is currently connected to a host, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: set_no_delay
method.description: Disables Nagle's algorithm to improve latency for small packets. [b]Note:[/b] For applications that send large packets or need to transfer a lot of data, this can decrease the total available bandwidth.

constants.constant: The initial status of the [StreamPeerTCP]. This is also the status after disconnecting.
A status representing a [StreamPeerTCP] that is connecting to a host.
A status representing a [StreamPeerTCP] that is connected to a host.
A status representing a [StreamPeerTCP] in error state.
